scenarioDescription:
The RR Cae Exoplanetary System


Overview

RR Cae is a star with 0.44 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 69.12 light years away from the solar system.

RR Cae is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the RR Cae system


RR Cae b

RR Cae b was discovered by the Leoncito Astronomical Complex observatory, in 2012-05, using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 5.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of RR Cae b is 1335.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of RR Cae b is 13.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, RR Cae b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system RR Cae, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Leoncito Astronomical Complex.
name: RR Cae - System With 1 Exoplanet
